00001 package se.kth.md.simulinkExchange.modelConversion.simulink.preprocessing;
00002 
00003 import java.util.ArrayList;
00004 import java.util.Collection;
00005 
00006 import Simulink.Inport;
00007 import Simulink.Line;
00008 import Simulink.Outport;
00009 import Simulink.Port;
00010 import Simulink.ProtoObject;
00011 import Simulink.System;
00012 import Simulink.SystemReference;
00013 
00014 public class LinesProcessor {
00015         
00016         System theSystem;
00017         
00018         public static Collection<? extends ProtoObject> doIt(System aSystem) {
00019                 
00020                 LinesProcessor lp = new LinesProcessor();
00021                 lp.theSystem = aSystem;
00022                 return lp.process();
00023         }
00024 
00025         private Collection<? extends ProtoObject> process() {
00026                 ArrayList<ProtoObject> list = new ArrayList<ProtoObject>();
00027                 for (Line aLine : theSystem.getLines()) {
00028                         process( aLine );
00029                         list.add( aLine );
00030                 }
00031                 return list;
00032         }
00033 
00034         private void process(Line aLine) {
00035                 String simuName = null;
00036                 simuName = processPort(aLine, aLine.getSource());
00037                 aLine.setSimuNameSrc(simuName);
00038                 simuName = processPort(aLine, aLine.getDestination());
00039                 aLine.setSimuNameDst(simuName);
00040         }
00041         
00042         
00043         private String processPort(Line aLine, Port port) {
00044                 String simuName = null;
00045                 System portParentSys = obtainPortParent( port );
00046                 if ( portBelongsToSubsystem(aLine, portParentSys) ) {
00047                         SystemReference block = findBlockNameWithinReferences( aLine, portParentSys );
00048                         simuName = block.getName() + '/' + findPosInBlock(block.getTarget(), port); 
00049                 } else {
00050                         simuName = port.getName() + "/1";  
00051                 }
00052                 return simuName;
00053         }
00054 
00055         private Integer findPosInBlock(System aSystem, Port port) {
00056                 int index = aSystem.getInports().indexOf(port);
00057                 if ( index == -1 ) {
00058                         index = aSystem.getOutports().indexOf(port);
00059                 }               
00060                 return index+1;
00061         }
00062 
00063         private System obtainPortParent(Port port) {
00064                 // Hack to circumvent EMF inheritance issue:
00065                 // getParent is defined for Inport and Outport, 
00066                 // but it cannot be called from Port.
00067                 // In Java, you are guilty until you prove different, =(
00068                 System parent = null;
00069                 String type = port.eClass().getName();
00070                 if (type.equalsIgnoreCase("Inport")) {
00071                         parent = ((Inport)port).getParent();
00072                 } else {
00073                         parent = ((Outport)port).getParent();
00074                 }
00075                 return parent;
00076         }
00077 
00078         private SystemReference findBlockNameWithinReferences(Line aLine, System portParentSys) {
00079                 for (SystemReference sysRef : aLine.getParent().getChildren()) {
00080                         if ( sysRef.getTarget() == portParentSys ) {
00081                                 return sysRef; 
00082                                 }
00083                 }
00084                 return null;
00085         }
00086 
00087         private boolean portBelongsToSubsystem(Line aLine, System portParentSys) {
00088                 if ( aLine.getParent() == portParentSys ) { 
00089                         return false;}
00090                 else { 
00091                         return true; }
00092         }
00093 
00094 }
